DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 router within a VRF
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command configure an OSPFv2 router. User can optionally specify VRF on which the router have to be configured. If VRF name is not specified then the command is considered for VRF default. Upon successful configuration CLI mode will be changed to config-router-ospf. Technical details on OSPFv2 support is also available at http://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# router ospf sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# or sonic-cli(config)# router ospf vrf Vrf-blue sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 router within a VRF
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command unconfigure an OSPFv2 router. User can optionally specify VRF on which the router have to be configured. If VRF name is not specified then the command is considered for VRF default.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# no router ospf or sonic-cli(config)# no router ospf vrf Vrf-blue

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Displays current OSPFv2 router configuration
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to display running configurations within current OSPFv2 router.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# show configuration ! router ospf ospf router-id 10.1.1.1 network 10.10.3.0/24 area 0.0.0.1 network 10.10.4.0/24 area 0.0.0.1

PARAM.name: default-cost
PARAM.help: Configure NSSA or stub area summary default cost

PARAM.name: filter-list
PARAM.help: Configure inter area prefix filter lists

PARAM.name: in
PARAM.help: Filter incoming prefixes into the area

PARAM.name: out
PARAM.help: Filter outgoing prefixes from the area

PARAM.name: range
PARAM.help: Configure address range summarization on border routers

PARAM.name: cost
PARAM.help: Configure cost for the advertising address range

PARAM.name: cost
PARAM.help: Configure cost for the advertising address range

PARAM.name: substitute
PARAM.help: Configure substitute prefix for the address range

PARAM.name: no-summary
PARAM.help: Disable inter-area route injection into the stub

PARAM.name: vlinkip
PARAM.help: Router ID of the remote ABR

PARAM.name: authentication
PARAM.help: Enable authentication on the virtual link

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures area parameters within an OSPFv2 router
DOCGEN.USAGE:
Use this command to configure area related parameters within an OSPFv2 router. Below command options can be used area <area-id> Configures an area within a router by specifying an area-id in positive integer or dotted format.
area <area-id> authentication [message-digest] Configures area level authentication mode. Authentocation mode can be clear text authentication or message-digest authentication.
area <area-id> default-cost <cost-value> Configures NSSA or stub-area summary default cost.
area <area-id>> filter-list prefix <prefix-list-name> in|out Configures prefix list for inter area prefix filtering. Inter area prefix propagation policies are configured using this command. Option 'in' is used for filetring incoming prefixes from the area and 'out' is used for filtering outgoing prefixes from the area.
area <area-id> range <ip-prefix> [ cost <cost-value> | advertise cost <cost-value> | not-advertise | substitute <ip-prefix> ] Configures address ranges for inter area address propagation. Inter area prefix propagation policies can also be configured using this command. This command enables to configure prefix advertising rules directly without using andy prefix list. Cost of an advertized prefix can be modified using this command. Similarly a advertized prefix can be substituted by another prefix.
area <area-id> stub [ no-summary ] Configures area to be stub area with stub options.
area <area-id> shortcut enable|disable|default Configures area shortcut options.
area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> authentication [ null | message-digest ] area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> authentication-key <key> [ encrpted ] area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> message-digest-key <key-id> md5 <key> [ encrpted ] area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> dead-interval <time-value> area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> hello-interval <time-value> area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> retransmit-interval <time-value> area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> transmit-delay <time-value> Configures virtual link and its parameters in an area. Virtual link configurations are allowed on non-backbone area. Virtual links can have clear text password, message-digest based passwords or no password configured at all. When clear text and message digest passsword is configured, corresponding authentication-key or message-digest-key parameters must be configured. Timer parameters can also be configured for any Virtual links. Authentication key or password will be saved in encrypted form in configuration. User shall always provide actual password while configuring authentication keys. It is not recomended to use encrypted option of authentication key.

EXAMPLE.summary: Area command examples

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19.1.1.19
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 authentication sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 authentication message-digest
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 filter-list prefix plist-area10_in in sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 filter-list prefix plist-area10_out out
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 range 10.1.1.2/24 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 range 10.1.1.0/24 cost 48 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 range 10.2.2.0/24 not-advertise sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 range 10.3.3.0/24 substitute 192.3.3.0/24
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 stub sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 stub no summary
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 shortcut enable
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication null sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication message-digest sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication-key password sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 message-digest-key 19 md5 md5password sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 dead-interval 60 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 hello-interval 20 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 retransmit-interval 15 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 transmit-delay 10

PARAM.name: default-cost
PARAM.help: Unconfigure NSSA or stub area summary default cost

PARAM.name: filter-list
PARAM.help: Unconfigure inter area prefix filter lists

PARAM.name: range
PARAM.help: Unconfigure address range or its parameters

PARAM.name: cost
PARAM.help: Unconfigure cost for the advertising address range

PARAM.name: cost
PARAM.help: Unconfigure cost for the advertising address range

PARAM.name: substitute
PARAM.help: Unconfigure substitute prefix for the address range

PARAM.name: stub
PARAM.help: Unconfigure area as stub or its parameters

PARAM.name: no-summary
PARAM.help: Enable inter-area route injection into the stub

PARAM.name: virtual-link
PARAM.help: Unconfigure Virtual link or its parameters

PARAM.name: vlinkip
PARAM.help: Router ID of the remote ABR

PARAM.name: authentication
PARAM.help: Disable authentication on the virtual link

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures area parameters within an OSPFv2 router
DOCGEN.USAGE:
Use this command to unconfigure area related parameters within an OSPFv2 router. Below command options can be used no area <area-id> Unconfigures an area within a router by specifying an area-id in positive integer or dotted format.
no area <area-id> authentication [message-digest] Unconfigures area level authentication mode.
no area <area-id> default-cost <cost-value> Unconfigures NSSA or stub-area summary default cost.
no area <area-id>> filter-list prefix in|out Unconfigures prefix list for inter area prefix filtering. Unconfigures in prefixlist or out prefixlist.
no area <area-id> range <ip-prefix> [ cost | advertise cost | not-advertise | substitute ] Unconfigures address ranges for inter area address propagation.
no area <area-id> stub [ no-summary ] Unconfigures area being stub area with stub options.
no area <area-id> shortcut Unconfigures area shortcut.
no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> authentication [ null | message-digest ] no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> authentication-key no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> message-digest-key <key-id> md5 no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> dead-interval no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> hello-interval no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> retransmit-interval no area <area-id> virtual-link <remote-router-id> transmit-delay Unconfigures virtual link and its parameters in an area.

EXAMPLE.summary: Area command unconfiguration examples

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19.1.1.19
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 authentication sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 authentication message-digest
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 filter-list prefix in sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 filter-list prefix out
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 range 10.1.1.2/24 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 range 10.1.1.0/24 cost sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 range 10.2.2.0/24 not-advertise sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 range 10.3.3.0/24 substitute
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 stub sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 stub no summary
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 shortcut
sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication null sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication message-digest sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 authentication-key sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 message-digest-key 19 md5 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 dead-interval sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 hello-interval sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 retransmit-interval sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no area 19 virtual-link 1.1.1.9 transmit-delay

COMMAND.name: auto-cost
COMMAND.help: Configure interface auto cost reference bandwidth

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures interface auto cost reference bandwidth
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure interface auto cost reference bandwidth. Whenever interface cost is not configured explicitely, refrence bandwidth value will be used to calculate the interface cost.

EXAMPLE.summary: configuring auto cost reference bandwidth

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# auto-cost reference-bandwidth 10000

COMMAND.name: no auto-cost
COMMAND.help: Unconfigure interface auto cost reference bandwidth

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures interface auto cost reference bandwidth
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure interface auto cost reference bandwidth.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures auto cost reference bandwidth

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no auto-cost reference-bandwidth

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 RFC1583 compatibility
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure RFC1583 compatibility.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures RFC1583 compatibility

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# compatible rfc1583

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 RFC1583 compatibility
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure RFC1583 compatibility.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures RFC1583 compatibility

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no compatible rfc1583

PARAM.name: metric
PARAM.help: Configure metric for the default route

PARAM.name: metric-type
PARAM.help: Configure metric type for the default route

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Configure route map for the default routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures default information origination policy rules.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configures default route information origination parameters. Metric value and metric type can be explicitely specified for default routes. Route map rules can also be applied on default routes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures default route origination parameters

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# default-information originate always sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# default-information originate metric 80 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# default-information originate metric-type 1 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# default-information originate route-map rmap_droute

PARAM.name: always
PARAM.help: Disable always advertise of default route

PARAM.name: metric
PARAM.help: Unconfigure metric for the default route

PARAM.name: metric-type
PARAM.help: Unconfigure metric type for the default route

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Unconfigure route map for the default routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures default information origination parameters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigures default route information origination parameters.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures default route origination parameters

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no default-information originate always sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no default-information originate metric sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no default-information originate metric-type sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no default-information originate route-map

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures default metric for redistributed routes.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configures metric for redistributed routes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures default metric for redistributed routes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# default-metric 28

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures default metric for redistributed routes.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigures metric for redistributed routes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures default metric for redistributed routes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no default-metric

PARAM.name: admindistance
PARAM.help: Distance value for all type of routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures distance value to OSPFv2 routes.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure route distance value to OSPFv2 routes. Distance value can also be configured based on route types link inter-area routes, intra-area routes and external routes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures distance value to OSPFv2 routes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# distance ospf 40 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# distance intra-area 10 inter-area 20 external 30

PARAM.name: ospf
PARAM.help: Unconfigure distance value for all type of routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures distance value for OSPFv2 routes.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure route distance value.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures distance value to OSPFv2 routes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no distance ospf sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no distance intra-area sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no distance inter-area

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enables OSPFv2 adjacency state logs.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to enable OSPFv2 adjacency state logs.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enables OSPFv2 adjacency state logs.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# log-adjacency-changes sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# log-adjacency-changes detail

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disables OSPFv2 adjacency state logs.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to disable OSPFv2 adjacency state logs.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures distance value to OSPFv2 routes.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no log-adjacency-changes detail sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no log-adjacency-changes

COMMAND.name: max-metric
COMMAND.help: Enable infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs

PARAM.name: router-lsa
PARAM.help: Enable infinite metric on router LSAs

PARAM.name: administrative
PARAM.help: Enable administrative type infinite metric advertising

PARAM.name: on-startup
PARAM.help: Enable infinite metric advertising at OSPFv2 router startup

PARAM.name: interdistance
PARAM.help: Duration in seconds to advertise max metric

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Enables router LSA all link max metric advertising

PARAM.name: include-stub
PARAM.help: Enables router LSA stub link max metric advertising

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enables infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to enable infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs. Max-metric can be enabled administratively or during OSPFv2 startup time. When enabled administratively, max-metric advertizing will be effective till it is unconfigures explicitely. When enabled for restrt time, max-metric will be advertised for a period of time specified in the config.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enables infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# max-metric router-lsa administrative sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# max-metric router-lsa on-startup 90

COMMAND.name: no max-metric
COMMAND.help: Disable infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs

PARAM.name: router-lsa
PARAM.help: Disable infinite metric on router LSAs

PARAM.name: administrative
PARAM.help: Disable administrative type infinite metric advertising

PARAM.name: on-startup
PARAM.help: Disable infinite metric advertising at OSPFv2 router startup

PARAM.name: all
PARAM.help: Disable router LSA all link max metric advertising

PARAM.name: include-stub
PARAM.help: Disable router LSA stub link max metric advertising

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disables infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to disable max-metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs.

EXAMPLE.summary: Disables infinite metric advertising in OSPFv2 LSAs

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no max-metric router-lsa administrative sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no max-metric router-lsa on-startup

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures networks in an area.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure or associate network addresses into specific areas. Interfaces belonging to these network addresses will be condidere as part of the area specified. This config command is mutually exclusive with interface mode area command within a VRF. When network command is used in a VRF, area command cannot be used at interface mode configuration.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures networks in an area.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# network 10.1.1.0/24 area 0 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# network 19.1.1.0/16 area 19

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures networks in an area.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to snconfigure or dissassociate network addresses into specific areas.

EXAMPLE.summary: unconfigures networks in an area.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no network 10.1.1.0/24 area 0 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no network 19.1.1.0/16 area 19

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 router parameters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 router parameters like router-id and ABR type.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 router parameters.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unonfigures OSPFv2 router parameters.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 router parameters like router-id and ABR type.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures router ID and ABR type.

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 router ABR type.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 router ABR type.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures router ABR type.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# ospf abr-type shortcut sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# ospf abr-type cisco

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 ABR type.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 ABR type.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures router ABR type.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no ospf abr-type

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 router ID.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 router ID. At the time of OSPFv2 router startup or new configuration, if the router-id configuration is not present then the highest IPv4 address among the available IPv4 interfaces will be considered as router-id. Upon configuring a specific router-id, newly configured router-id will be used. Upon unconfiguring a router-id, same router-id will continue to be used till next router-id config or system restart or OSPFv2 router unconfigure.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 router ID.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# ospf router-id 19.1.1.1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 router ID.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 router ID.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures OSPFv2 router ID.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no ospf router-id

PARAM.name: default
PARAM.help: Suppresses OSPFv2 routing updates on all interfaces

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 passive interfaces.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 passive interfaces. Default mode makes all interfaces as passive interface. When default mode is enabled, user will be able to activate chosen interaces by enabling non-passive mode of passive interface configuration.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 passive interfaces.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# passive-interface Ethernet0 or sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# passive-interface default sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# passive-interface Ethernet0 non-passive

PARAM.name: default
PARAM.help: Suppress routing updates on interfaces by default

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 passive interfaces.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 passive interfaces.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures OSPFv2 passive interfaces.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no passive-interface Ethernet0 sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no passive-interface default

COMMAND.name: redistribute
COMMAND.help: Configure route redistribution into OSPFv2 router

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Route map to filter redistributed routes

PARAM.name: connected
PARAM.help: Directly connected or attached subnets and hosts

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Route map to filter redistributed routes

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Route map to filter redistributed routes

PARAM.name: kernel
PARAM.help: Kernel routes other than FRR installed routes

PARAM.name: route-map
PARAM.help: Route map to filter redistributed routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures route redistribution into OSPFv2 router.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure route redistribution into OSPFv2 router. Redistributed route's metric and metric-type can be modified using this commands. Route map can also be aslo be applied to redistributed route. Unconfiguring any of the redistribute attribute for a protocol will unconfigure all attributes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures route redistribution into OSPFv2 router.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# redistribute bgp sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# redistribute bgp route-map bgpospfrmap sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# redistribute static metric 10 metrict-type 1 routemap redist_rmap sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# redistribute connected metric 10 metrict-type 1

COMMAND.name: no redistribute
COMMAND.help: Unconfigures route redistribution into OSPFv2 router

PARAM.name: connected
PARAM.help: Directly connected or attached subnets and hosts

PARAM.name: kernel
PARAM.help: Kernel routes other than FRR installed routes

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures route redistribution into OSPFv2 router.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure route redistribution into OSPFv2 router. Unconfiguring any of the redistribute attribute for a protocol will unconfigure all attributes.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures route redistribution into OSPFv2 router.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no redistribute bgp sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no redistribute bgp route-map

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# refresh timer 20

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures OSPFv2 LSA refresh interval

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no refresh timer

PARAM.name: spfinitialholdtime
PARAM.help: SPF initial hold time in milliseconds

PARAM.name: spfmaxholdtime
PARAM.help: SPF maximum hold time in milliseconds

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# timers lsa min-arrival sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# timers throttle lsa all sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# timers throttle spf 10 20 30

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures OSPFv2 LSA and SPF intervals

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no timers lsa min-arrival sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no timers throttle lsa all sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no timers throttle spf

PARAM.name: maxinterfacewrite
PARAM.help: Maximum number of interfaces serviced per write

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures OSPFv2 write multiplier.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure OSPFv2 write multiplier.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configures OSPFv2 write multiplier

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# write-multiplier 20

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures OSPFv2 write multiplier.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure OSPFv2 write multiplier.

EXAMPLE.summary: Unconfigures OSPFv2 write multiplier

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config-router-ospf)# no write-multiplier

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: One or all interfaces in within a VRF

PARAM.name: interface
PARAM.help: One or all interfaces in within a VRF

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command clears/resets OSPFv2 sessions on an OSPFv2 interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to clear OSPFv2 sessions. Following is a partial list of information with command syntax that can be cleared. - clear ip ospf interface IF-NAME This command clears all OSPFv2 sessions on an OSPFv2 interface - clear ip ospf vrf VRF-NAME interface IF-NAME This command clears all OSPFv2 sessions on interface in VRF VRF-NAME

EXAMPLE.summary: Below commands clear sessions on Ethernt64

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# clear ip ospf interface Ethernet64 sonic# clear ip ospf vrf default interface Ethernet64

PARAM.name: border-routers
PARAM.help: Display all OSPFv2 ABR's and ASBR's

PARAM.name: lsid
PARAM.help: Link State ID (as an IP address)

PARAM.name: lsid
PARAM.help: Link State ID (as an IP address)

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display show related ospf information for a specific vrf
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to display global, neighbors, interfaces etc information related to an OSPFv2 router. User can optionally specify VRF on which the router have to be configured. If VRF name is not specified then the command is considered for VRF default. Technical details on OSPFv2 support is also available at http://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/

EXAMPLE.summary: Display global ospf information for default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: device# show ip ospf OSPF Routing Process, Router ID: 1.1.1.1 Supports only single TOS (TOS0) routes This implementation conforms to RFC2328 RFC1583Compatibility flag is enabled OpaqueCapability flag is disabled Initial SPF scheduling delay 0 millisec(s) Minimum hold time between consecutive SPFs 50 millisec(s) Maximum hold time between consecutive SPFs 5000 millisec(s) Hold time multiplier is currently 1 time is 92031756 SPF algorithm last executed 1065d4h22m ago Last SPF duration 0.0s SPF timer is inactive LSA minimum interval 5000 msecs LSA minimum arrival 1000 msecs Write Multiplier set to 20 Refresh timer 10 secs Number of external LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of opaque AS LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of areas attached to this router: 2 Area ID: 0.0.0.0 (Backbone) Number of interfaces in this area: Total: 1 , Active: 1 Number of fully adjacent neighbors in this area: 1 Area has no authentication SPF algorithm executed 8 times Number of LSA 3 Number of router LSA 2. Checksum Sum 0x40f64b4000000000 Number of network LSA 1. Checksum Sum 0x40d5adc000000000 Number of summary LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of ASBR summary LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of NSSA LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of opaque link LSA . Checksum Sum 0x Number of opaque area LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Area ID: 0.0.0.1 Number of interfaces in this area: Total: 1 , Active: 1 Number of fully adjacent neighbors in this area: 0 Area has no authentication SPF algorithm executed 1 times Number of LSA 2 Number of router LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of network LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of summary LSA 2. Checksum Sum 0x40f1f61000000000 Number of ASBR summary LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of NSSA LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0 Number of opaque link LSA . Checksum Sum 0x Number of opaque area LSA 0. Checksum Sum 0x0

EXAMPLE.summary: Display neighbor information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf neighbor | no-more
Neighbor ID Pri State Dead Time Address Interface RXmtL RqstL DBsmL 10.59.142.247 1 Full/Backup 37.343s 64.1.1.2 Ethernet64:64.1.1.1 0 0 0
Leaf1# show ip ospf neighbor Ethernet66 | no-more
Neighbor ID Pri State Dead Time Address Interface RXmtL RqstL DBsmL 2.2.2.2 1 Full/Backup 38.245s 64.1.1.2 Ethernet66:64.1.1.1 0 0 0

EXAMPLE.summary: Display neighbor detailed information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf neighbor detail | no-more Neighbor 10.59.142.247, interface address 64.1.1.2 In the area 0.0.0.0 via interface Ethernet64 Neighbor priority is 1, State is Full, 6 state changes Most recent state change statistics: Progressive change 7h3m25s ago DR is 64.1.1.1, BDR is 64.1.1.2 Options 2 *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- Dead timer due in 30.687s Database Summary List 0 Link State Request List 0 Link State Retransmission List 0 Thread Inactivity Timer on Thread Database Description Retransmision off Thread Link State Request Retransmission on Thread Link State Update Retransmission on
Leaf1# show ip ospf neighbor 2.2.2.2 | no-more Neighbor 2.2.2.2, interface address 64.1.1.2 In the area 0.0.0.0 via interface Ethernet66 Neighbor priority is 1, State is Full, 5 state changes Most recent state change statistics: Progressive change 0h1m11s ago DR is 64.1.1.1, BDR is 64.1.1.2 Options 2 *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- Dead timer due in 33.203s Database Summary List 0 Link State Request List 0 Link State Retransmission List 0 Thread Inactivity Timer on Thread Database Description Retransmision off Thread Link State Request Retransmission on Thread Link State Update Retransmission on
Neighbor 2.2.2.2, interface address 65.1.1.2 In the area 0.0.0.1 via interface Ethernet67 Neighbor priority is 1, State is Full, 5 state changes Most recent state change statistics: Progressive change 0h1m10s ago DR is 65.1.1.1, BDR is 65.1.1.2 Options 2 *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- Dead timer due in 34.590s Database Summary List 0 Link State Request List 0 Link State Retransmission List 0 Thread Inactivity Timer on Thread Database Description Retransmision off Thread Link State Request Retransmission on Thread Link State Update Retransmission on

EXAMPLE.summary: Display interface information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf interface | no-more VRF Name: default Ethernet64 is up ifindex 128, MTU 9100 bytes, BW 25000 Mbit UP,BROADCAST,RUNNING,MULTICAST Internet Address 64.1.1.1/24, Broadcast 64.1.1.255, Area 0.0.0.0 MTU mismatch detection: enabled Router ID 10.59.143.131, Network Type BROADCAST, Cost: 4 Transmit Delay is 1 sec, State DR, Priority 1 Backup Designated Router (ID) 10.59.142.247, Interface Address 64.1.1.2 Saved Network-LSA sequence number 0x8000000f Multicast group memberships: OSPFAllRouters OSPFDesignatedRouters Timer intervals configured, Hello 10s, Dead 40s, Wait 40s, Retransmit 5 Hello due in 9.023s Neighbor Count is 1, Adjacent neighbor count is 1
Leaf1# show ip ospf interface Ethernet67 | no-more VRF Name: default Ethernet67 is up ifindex 926, MTU 9100 bytes, BW 25000 Mbit UP,BROADCAST,RUNNING,MULTICAST Internet Address 65.1.1.1/24, Broadcast 65.1.1.255, Area 0.0.0.1 MTU mismatch detection: enabled Router ID 1.1.1.1, Network Type BROADCAST, Cost: 4 Transmit Delay is 1 sec, State DR, Priority 1 Backup Designated Router (ID) 2.2.2.2, Interface Address 65.1.1.2 Multicast group memberships: OSPFAllRouters OSPFDesignatedRouters Timer intervals configured, Hello 10s, Dead 40s, Wait 40s, Retransmit 5 Hello due in 7.957s Neighbor Count is 1, Adjacent neighbor count is 1

EXAMPLE.summary: Display interface traffic information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf interface traffic | no-more
Interface HELLO DB-Desc LS-Req LS-Update LS-Ack Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ethernet64 2563/2563 3/3 1/1 17/30 29/16
Leaf1# show ip ospf interface traffic Ethernet67 | no-more
Interface HELLO DB-Desc LS-Req LS-Update LS-Ack Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ethernet67 19/22 2/3 1/1 3/3 2/2

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf database | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (10.59.143.131)
Router Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum Link count 10.59.142.247 10.59.142 1682 0x80000011 0xb56b 1 10.59.143.131 10.59.143 1498 0x80000011 0xdc2c 1
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum 64.1.1.1 10.59.143.131 1538 0x8000000f 0x1c70

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database router information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf database router | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (10.59.143.131)
Router Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
LS age: 1709 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x6 Flags: 0x0 : LS Type: router-LSA Link State ID: 10.59.142.247 Advertising Router: 10.59.142 LS Seq Number: 80000011 Checksum: 0xb56b Length: 36
Number of Links: 1
Link connected to: a Transit Network (Link ID) Designated Router address: 64.1.1.1 (Link Data) Router Interface address: 64.1.1.2 Number of TOS metrics: 0 TOS 0 Metric: 4
LS age: 1525 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x3 Flags: 0x0 : LS Type: router-LSA Link State ID: 10.59.143.131 Advertising Router: 10.59.143 LS Seq Number: 80000011 Checksum: 0xdc2c Length: 36
Number of Links: 1
Link connected to: a Transit Network (Link ID) Designated Router address: 64.1.1.1 (Link Data) Router Interface address: 64.1.1.1 Number of TOS metrics: 0 TOS 0 Metric: 4

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database network information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf database network | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (10.59.143.131)
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
LS age: 1602 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x3 LS Type: network-LSA Link State ID: 64.1.1.1 (address of Designated Router) Advertising Router: 10.59.143.131 LS Seq Number: 8000000f Checksum: 0x1c70 Length: 32
Network Mask: /24 Attached Router: 10.59.142.247
Attached Router: 10.59.143.131

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database summary information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
Leaf1# show ip ospf database summary | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1)
Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
LS age: 468 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x11 LS Type: summary-LSA Link State ID: 65.1.1.0 (summary Network Number) Advertising Router: 1.1.1.1 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x0e04 Length: 28
Network Mask: /24 TOS: 0 Metric: 4
LS age: 429 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x6 LS Type: summary-LSA Link State ID: 65.1.1.0 (summary Network Number) Advertising Router: 2.2.2.2 LS Seq Number: 80000002 Checksum: 0xed1f Length: 28
Network Mask: /24 TOS: 0 Metric: 4
Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.1)
LS age: 468 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x11 LS Type: summary-LSA Link State ID: 64.1.1.0 (summary Network Number) Advertising Router: 1.1.1.1 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x1bf7 Length: 28
Network Mask: /24 TOS: 0 Metric: 4
LS age: 429 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x6 LS Type: summary-LSA Link State ID: 64.1.1.0 (summary Network Number) Advertising Router: 2.2.2.2 LS Seq Number: 80000002 Checksum: 0xfa13 Length: 28
Network Mask: /24 TOS: 0 Metric: 4

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database asbr-summary information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
Leaf1# show ip ospf database asbr-summary | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1)
ASBR-Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
LS age: 38 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Type: summary-LSA Link State ID: 2.2.2.2 (AS Boundary Router address) Advertising Router: 1.1.1.1 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x0b41 Length: 28
Network Mask: /0 TOS: 0 Metric: 4

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database external information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
Leaf1# show ip ospf database external | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1)
AS External Link States
LS age: 52 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x6 LS Type: AS-external-LSA Link State ID: 25.1.1.1 (External Network Number) Advertising Router: 2.2.2.2 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x0892 Length: 36
Network Mask: /32 Metric Type: 2 (Larger than any link state path) TOS: 0 Metric: 20 Forward Address: 0.0.0.0 External Route Tag: 0

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database max-age LSA information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: Leaf1# show ip ospf database max-age OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1) MaxAge Link States:

EXAMPLE.summary: Display self originated database information for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
Leaf1# show ip ospf database self-originate | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1)
Router Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum Link count 1.1.1.1 1.1.1.1 777 0x80000004 0x7b42 1
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum 64.1.1.1 1.1.1.1 777 0x80000001 0x8581
Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum Route 65.1.1.0 1.1.1.1 816 0x80000001 0x0e04 65.1.1.0/24
ASBR-Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum 2.2.2.2 1.1.1.1 360 0x80000001 0x0b41
Router Link States (Area 0.0.0.1)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum Link count 1.1.1.1 1.1.1.1 776 0x80000004 0x8d2e 1
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.1)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum 65.1.1.1 1.1.1.1 776 0x80000001 0x788d
Summary Link States (Area 0.0.0.1)
Link ID ADV Router Age Seq# CkSum Route 64.1.1.0 1.1.1.1 816 0x80000001 0x1bf7 64.1.1.0/24

EXAMPLE.summary: Display database network information with advertising-router option for ospf on default vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
Leaf1# show ip ospf database network adv-router 1.1.1.1 | no-more VRF Name: default
OSPF Router with ID (1.1.1.1)
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.0)
LS age: 886 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x3 LS Type: network-LSA Link State ID: 64.1.1.1 (address of Designated Router) Advertising Router: 1.1.1.1 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x8581 Length: 32
Network Mask: /24 Attached Router: 1.1.1.1
Attached Router: 2.2.2.2
Net Link States (Area 0.0.0.1)
LS age: 886 Options: 0x2 : *|-|-|-|-|-|E|- LS Flags: 0x3 LS Type: network-LSA Link State ID: 65.1.1.1 (address of Designated Router) Advertising Router: 1.1.1.1 LS Seq Number: 80000001 Checksum: 0x788d Length: 32
Network Mask: /24 Attached Router: 1.1.1.1
Attached Router: 2.2.2.2

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Display ospf route information for a user-vrf
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to display ospf routes in an OSPFv2 router. User can optionally specify VRF on which the router have to be configured. If VRF name is not specified then the command is considered for VRF default. Technical details on OSPFv2 support is also available at http://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/

EXAMPLE.summary: Display ospf route information for user vrf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip ospf vrf Vrf1 route | no-more VRF Name: Vrf1 ============ OSPF network routing table ============ N 101.1.1.0/24 [10] area: 0.0.0.0 directly attached to Vlan101
============ OSPF router routing table =============
============ OSPF external routing table ===========
